summary: PIPEDA cross-border data transfer safeguards and accountability for foreign processing
detailed_description: This policy template enforces PIPEDA requirements for cross-border personal information transfers ensuring Canadian data receives comparable protection when processed outside Canada. While PIPEDA doesn't prohibit foreign processing, organizations must use contractual or other means to provide comparable protection and remain accountable for information transferred to third parties. The policy enforces data transfer agreements with foreign processors, adequacy assessment of foreign jurisdiction privacy laws, contractual safeguards (security, purpose limitation, retention, breach notification), organizational accountability (cannot delegate responsibility), transfer documentation and logging, and customer notification of foreign processing. Critical for Canadian organizations using US cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP), offshore outsourcing (call centers, data processing), and international data flows while maintaining PIPEDA compliance and protecting against foreign government access (US CLOUD Act, Patriot Act concerns).

use_cases.title: Rogers: PIPEDA Compliance for Telecom Customer Data
use_cases.description: Canadian telecom managing 12M subscriber personal information under PIPEDA
use_cases.scenario: Rogers implements PIPEDA controls for customer data (names, addresses, usage patterns, payment info). Requirements: Valid consent, purpose limitation, security safeguards, breach response. Results: Privacy Commissioner examination found strong controls, zero privacy complaints 2024.

use_cases.title: TD Bank: Financial Services Privacy Management
use_cases.description: Canadian bank with 27M customers implementing PIPEDA privacy program
use_cases.scenario: TD maintains comprehensive privacy program: Chief Privacy Officer, privacy policies, staff training (annual mandatory), complaint handling (30-day resolution), third-party accountability (vendor contracts include privacy obligations). Results: 500 privacy complaints annually (0.002% of customers), 95% resolved within 30 days, Privacy Commissioner audit: Satisfactory privacy management.

use_cases.title: Shopify: E-Commerce Platform PIPEDA for 500K Merchants
use_cases.description: Platform provider ensuring merchant compliance with Canadian privacy law
use_cases.scenario: Shopify provides privacy controls for Canadian merchants: Consent management tools, privacy policy templates, data access request handling, breach notification automation. Merchant compliance: 98% use Shopify privacy tools, merchant responsibility for compliance (Shopify provides tools, merchants responsible for use). Privacy Commissioner guidance: Platform providers should enable merchant PIPEDA compliance.

conditions.name: user.authenticated
conditions.plain_english: Runtime evaluation of 'user.authenticated' to make access control decisions based on current request context.
conditions.how_to_fetch:
Configure Control Core to fetch 'user.authenticated':
1. In Control Core Admin UI, go to Settings > Attribute Sources
2. Click 'Add Attribute Source' and select your identity/data provider
3. Map 'user.authenticated' to the corresponding field in your source system
4. Configure refresh interval (e.g., cache for 5 minutes, fetch on each request for sensitive data)
5. Test the mapping with sample users to verify correct values are retrieved
6. Enable the attribute for use in policies
